abstract: Drug abuse in China continues unabated, defying government crackdown that has sent tens of thousands of suspected drug offenders to jail and rehabilitation centers; Lui Yuejin, director general of government's anti-narcotics division, estimates that there are roughly 13 million drug addicts living in China.
lead_paragraph: For all the reported successes of China’s constantly expanding antidrug campaigns, the police appear to be winning few significant victories in what the authorities have called a “people’s war.”

byline.contributor: Chen Jiehao and Becky Davis contributed research.

snippet: For all the reported successes of China’s constantly expanding antidrug campaigns, the police appear to be winning few significant victories in what the authorities have called a “people’s war.”

keywords.value: Ministry of Public Security of the People's Republic of China
keywords.name: organizations

headline.main: Despite a Crackdown, Use of Illegal Drugs in China Continues Unabated
headline.print_headline: Despite a Crackdown, Use of Illegal Drugs in China Continues Unabated
